column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 1 Your PC's time is out of sync
column4: To fix this issue, user needs to synchronize your computer's time

column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 2 Local block data is corrupted
column4: To fix this issue, please delete the content of the DB-1.0 folder

column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 3 Launching node without admin rights
column4: Please make sure you launch the application with admin rights

column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 4 File missing
column4: to fix this issue, Please reinstall Daedalus and run the application

column1: resource exhausted (No space left on device)
column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 5 Not enough space on hard drive to store block data
column4: To fix this, please create more disk space on your computer

column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 6 Firewall is blocking the connection
column4: To fix this issue, please try other ISP provider

column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 7 Daedalus shows wrong Ada amount
column4: Unfortunately, there's no workaround for this solution. Please report support@iohk.io immediately

column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 8 Network error
column4: To fix this issue, please try other ISP provider

column1: IO error: Failed to create dir
column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 9 User is using non-latin characters for username
column4: To fix this issue, pleae change your PC's username using only latin-characters

column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 10 open.lock file is corrupted due to improper shutdown
column4: The issue is that the application was improperly shutdown. As a workaround, you'll need to delete open.lock file.

column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 10 open.lock file is corrupted due to improper shutdown
column4: The issue is that the application was improperly shutdown. As a workaround, you'll need to delete open.lock file.

column3: Daedalus Wallet Support Issue 11 Firewall is blocking the connection
column4: To fix this issue, please try other ISP provider

column3: Connect After Release 1.3.0 Error: certificate signature failure at TLSSocket.
column4: To Fix the issue, reinstall Daedelus.
